Barnyard grass.description: A major rice weed that competes strongly with crops. It grows rapidly, reduces yield, and is highly adaptive to wetland conditions.
control_methods: Pre-emergence herbicides (Butachlor, Pretilachlor)
Manual hand weeding during early growth stages to prevent seed set
Water management: Maintain consistent water depth to suppress seed germination

Bearded sprangletop.description: A grassy weed that reduces rice yield significantly. It competes with rice seedlings for nutrients and light, often found in dry patches.
control_methods: Herbicide spraying (Cyhalofop-butyl, Bispyribac-sodium)
Early water management: Maintain flooded conditions to prevent growth
Crop rotation: Plant non-rice crops to break the weed life cycle

Fimbristylis miliacea.description: A sedge weed commonly found in wet rice fields. Once established, it is difficult to remove and can compete strongly with rice.
control_methods: Pre-emergence herbicides (Oxadiargyl, Butachlor)
Manual removal before the seeds mature
Water depth management to suppress growth

Leptochloa filiformis.description: A grass weed present in paddy fields that competes with young rice seedlings. Can reduce yield if left uncontrolled.
control_methods: Post-emergence herbicides (Cyhalofop-butyl, Fenoxaprop-P-ethyl)
Hand weeding during early growth stages
Proper crop density to outcompete weeds naturally

Ludwigia parviflora.description: A broadleaf aquatic weed that can cover the water surface in rice fields, causing shading of rice plants and reducing growth.
control_methods: Manual removal to prevent shading
Herbicide application (2,4-D formulations) appropriate for aquatic weeds
Drainage and water management to reduce growth

Negative.description: No weed detected in the field image or sample.
control_methods: No action required

Ricefield millet.description: A grass weed commonly found in rice ecosystems. Competes for nutrients and light. Can rapidly infest rice fields.
control_methods: Herbicide spraying (Pendimethalin, Fenoxaprop)
Water management: Flooding or adjusting irrigation to suppress growth
Crop competition: Use vigorous rice varieties to naturally suppress weeds

Smallflower umbrella sedge.description: A common sedge weed in paddy fields. It is fast-growing and can dominate if left unmanaged.
control_methods: Post-emergence herbicides (Bispyribac-sodium)
Manual removal before flowering to prevent seed spread
Crop rotation to reduce infestation over time
